engine.components

Class SpriteComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.core.EntityComponent
      • engine.components.SpriteComponent

  • public class SpriteComponent
extends EntityComponent
    Represents a sprite that can be rendered on screen and animated.
    Author:
    Benny Bobaganoosh (thebennybox@gmail.com)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String NAME
      The name of this component when attached to an entity

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SpriteComponent(Bitmap[] frames, float[] frameTimes, int[] nextFrames, int transparencyType, float layer)
      Creates and initializes a sprite with a custom animation.
      SpriteComponent(Bitmap[] frames, float frameTime, int transparencyType, float layer)
      Creates and initializes a sprite with a basic looping animation.
      SpriteComponent(Bitmap sprite, int transparencyType, float layer)
      Creates and initializes a sprite with no animation.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      Updates the entity with proper render layers.

      Renders the current sprite to a render target.

    • Field Detail

      • NAME

        public static final java.lang.String NAME
        The name of this component when attached to an entity
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpriteComponent

        public SpriteComponent(Bitmap sprite,
               int transparencyType,
               float layer)
        Creates and initializes a sprite with no animation.
        Parameters:
        sprite - The image of the sprite
        transparencyType - The transparency algorithm used by the sprite. Should be set to a RenderContext.TRANSPARENCY_ value
        layer - The render layer of this sprite.

      • SpriteComponent

        public SpriteComponent(Bitmap[] frames,
               float frameTime,
               int transparencyType,
               float layer)
        Creates and initializes a sprite with a basic looping animation.
        Parameters:
        frames - An array of all the animation frames
        frameTime - The amount of time, in seconds, between each frame of animation
        transparencyType - The transparency algorithm used by the sprite. Should be set to a RenderContext.TRANSPARENCY_ value
        layer - The render layer of this sprite.

      • SpriteComponent

        public SpriteComponent(Bitmap[] frames,
               float[] frameTimes,
               int[] nextFrames,
               int transparencyType,
               float layer)
        Creates and initializes a sprite with a custom animation.
        Parameters:
        frames - An array of all the animation frames
        frameTimes - An array of the duration of each animation frame
        nextFrames - An array containing the indices of the next animation frame at each frame
        transparencyType - The transparency algorithm used by the sprite. Should be set to a RenderContext.TRANSPARENCY_ value
        layer - The render layer of this sprite.

    • Method Detail

      • onAdd

        public void onAdd()
        Updates the entity with proper render layers.

        Called whenever an entity adds this component.

        Overrides:
        onAdd in class EntityComponent

      • update

        public void update(Input input,
          float delta)
        Updates the animation, progressing, stopping, or restarting if necessary.

        Updates any parameters or properties of this component based on time, user input, or other factors.

        Overrides:
        update in class EntityComponent
        Parameters:
        input - User input to be considered
        delta - The amount of time, in seconds, since the last update.

      • render

        public void render(RenderContext target)
        Renders the current sprite to a render target.

        Renders anything this component needs to draw to a specific render target.

        Overrides:
        render in class EntityComponent
        Parameters:
        target - The location being rendered to.
